TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider

Docs.summary: Allows providing or validating additional custom data for antiforgery tokens. For example, the developer could use this to supply a nonce when the token is generated, then he could validate the nonce when the token is validated.
Docs.remarks: The antiforgery system already embeds the client's username within the generated tokens. This interface provides and consumes supplemental data. If an incoming antiforgery token contains supplemental data but no additional data provider is configured, the supplemental data will not be validated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAdditionalData(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides additional data to be stored for the antiforgery tokens generated during this request.
Docs.returns: Supplemental data to embed within the antiforgery token.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ValidateAdditionalData (Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext context, string additionalData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ValidateAdditionalData(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext context, string additionalData) cil managed

Docs.param: Supplemental data that was embedded within the token.
Docs.summary: Validates additional data that was embedded inside an incoming antiforgery token.
Docs.returns: True if the data is valid; false if the data is invalid.
